Comments_List: A great overview of pertinent ethical issues in clinical and basic research.

This class helped me to consider all viewpoints when discussing ethical dilemmas. While it's easy to approach an issue from your own point of view, when you consider the alternative approaches, it becomes much more difficult. I feel this class allowed me to practice deliberating issues from multiple views to provide a more complete evaluation of the ethical problems being discussed.
lecturers were wonderful, Dr. Dugdale's lectures are clearly well put together and thought out.  Guest lecturers were also very good.
I thought the class structure of a seminar-style with everyone being asked to contribute from their own personal backgrounds was very effective.
Yes, this is a very good overview of bioethics in research

I would absolutely recommend this class to other students at Yale. Any student studying in health sciences sections, whether medicine, public health, basic sciences, management, etc. needs to have an understanding of the ethical dilemmas he/she will face in school and beyond. This class was well designed to introduce these issues and help students analyze them within the appropriate framework.
